content: urban aran mitts by robbie laughlin about this pattern the urban aran mitts are quick and easy to make the cable that travels on the bias eats away at the seed stitch texture to reveal simple stockinette stitch they are designed to fit loosely so that they can be worn over thin gloves during colder months or alone during warmer months techniques used knitting in different textures knitting in the round increasing and decreasing basic cabling picking up stitches pattern notes these gloves look best in a solid heather or tweed yarn -
